<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="title=Zoom%2BZoom%2Bup%2Bthe%2BVAB%2521&channel=jasonlii&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&chapter_id=4109221"></object><br/>One rover. One ramp. One VAB wall. One shot. Can <a href="http://bit.ly/1ijwrii"><strong>JasonLii</strong></a> make this or is he doomed to failure? Find out in this <strong>Twitch</strong> teaser video.</p>
Perfect timing with that Parachute. Wish I could design cars like that too.
This is awesome. Someone should make an actual race track with raised turns and stuff. The streams are pretty much always awesome.

Alright Everyone, just wanted to express my SHOCK that this made it onto TwitchThursday! AverageJoe, someone DID make an actual track around the space center full of that stuff, which is what prompted me to do this. It was in deed Luizopiloto, but it was debated on weather or not he was using Hack Grav to get up the wall, and well - he was not. :3

So I give credit to Luiz for the insperation. And thank you Everyone for Enjoying what I do, and being a part of the comunity. See you all in space.

Edited April 25, 2014 by Kerbies_are_my_Minions
